Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: sahneadi
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in May for 3 days and was given one of the court looking rooms. Although the room was a bit dark and was not looking anywhere nice, I can say that it was spotless and good enough for a short city break. The place itself is on the main street and very close to the metro station -not that you would need it, Madrid is such a small city- and the owner was very helpful whilst we were there. Lack of English, but hey it is Spain. Will definitely recommend it as a cheap base for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, easy to find.”
Reviews.Author: sisiroe
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hostal just down the street from the Puerta del Sol with easy access to the metro and walking distance from many sites. The staff working the front desk is there 24 hours a day, so you never have to feel awkward about waking up someone when coming home from one of Madrid’s famous late nights. The single room was small, which is to be expected, but comfortable. There was too much perfume used in the cleaning process, but I soon figured out that this is kind of normal for Spain: they are obsessed with having things smell “nice.” The only real negative I found was that the walls are pretty thin: I could hear conversations from next door with almost perfect clarity. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lauren C
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent three nights at this hostel and had a great stay. The hostel is conveniently located right in the centre of Madrid and is literally a 1 minute walk to the metro station, Opera. It's location also makes it perfect for exploring Madrid on foot and is close to main tourist attractions such as the Royal Palace as well as several shops and restaurants. The room was absolutely spotless and cleaned daily. It felt more like a hotel than a hostel however there is a common room with a few chairs, drink machine and a computer with free wi-fi. We found the wi-fi signal to be quite weak in our room so we usually went to the common room. We would recommend this place for anyone looking for a quiet stay in the centre of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dan S
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this great hostel in central Madrid. The location is ideal for exploring Madrid, with a metro stop 30 seconds away and the Royal Palace a 2 minute walk away. Our room was on the street but the double glazing glass kept out all the noise, while the AC kept the room cool. In a common room there was a free to use computer with internet, which was useful to do research on the city. All in, great value for money, excellent location and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Metro; close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: onthegoalot2012
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights and found it to be in the perfect location. You walk off the metro and you are within 30 feet of the hotel entrance. Don't be afraid to use the buzzer on the door -- after you enter the hallway you take the elevator up a floor and are buzzed into yet another door to get to the reception desk. Once you get your room key, you use that to enter both doors to the building and your room. The staff was friendly. The room was small and clean. It was a bit cramped with my suitcase, but I was happy with how well the A/C worked and how nice the bathroom was. You really feel like you're in the center of things when you go out of the hotel. It was near shopping, food and the heart of Madrid and yet managed to feel quiet and private in the rooms -- definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Small clean room for reasonable price in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Peter A
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a weekend city visit for less than 50€. Central location, small, but clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: DJH1966
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location, reasonably priced, clean and tidy. I would thoroughly recommend staying here if you are travelling to Madrid. No negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jennykenny
Reviews.Content: Incredibly central, minutes from Sol and Plaza Mayor. Very reasonable, 40 euros for a single room. Room small but had everything needed. Looked out into an internal well, but it meant that there was very little noise. Occasional voices from the reception desk and phone ringing but not really intrusive, (room107). Hostal is on two floors; free (limited) Internet and pay for tea and coffe machines on their second floor. Staff very nice and helpful. Second time I have stayed there. There is also a small choice of paperbacks if you run out of reading material.

Reviews.Title: “Back in Madrid - back at Hostal Oriente”
Reviews.Author: lbx-se
Reviews.Content: Back in Madrid for a week of work. There may be better bargains around, but I don't dare take the risk. Most of the "complaints" are right. There is a smell of perfume, but not that strong. Rooms can be noisy, but so are all "older style" hotels and my wife who is "allergic" to noise did not complain when we had a plaza view room for five days last year. Rooms are small - at least the single rooms, but who wants to spend their time in the room (and I worked there for a day this year without problems). Staff only speak Spanish, but I got by with a little Italian and some handwaving - and the cleaning women speak some English. Add to that that rooms are clean (so says my wife;-) the staff is very friendly and the location is central. Go there, but don't book during a period where I will need a room ;-)

Reviews.Title: “a very nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: apexro
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hostal for 3 nights, this last weekend. The location is excellent. I booked a single room and it was on the inside part of the building. Very quiet over the night... The room was very clean. In fact they did the cleaning and changed the towels every single day. The stuff was very polite and friendly, even it was only one man who speaks English. They had a positive atitude and did everything possible to answer to all my requests. It really worths for the money and i will try to stay again here in my next trips to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Sharon d
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the oriente for 5 nights. Room small but comfortable and clean. Everything absolutely spotless. Staff kind and helpful As everyone else has said right in the heart of the city and everything close at hand. Only downside no Tea and coffee facilities but there is a machine at the hotel. Lots of cafes in the street so not far to go for coffee and breakfast. Would definately stay there again and would recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: cheezehead05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Oriente for four nights in late April. The location is fantastic. Puerto del Sol, Plaza Mayor, the royal palace and others are all very close. The metro is also across the street. The rooms are small but clean. The shower was extremely small. Overall, this is a great value in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location. Clean, pleasant rooms, helpful staff, decent size for such a good location.”
Reviews.Author: NightOwl34
Reviews.Content: First impressions can be misleading. We arrived here at 2am, bleary eyed due to airport delays. We had to ask the taxi driver to help us find the front door – we seemed to have the wrong address, with no well-lit hotel lobby, just a bright sign on the wall saying ‘Hostal Oriente’, above a suspiciously deserted, rainy city square! But no, he pointed out the small intercom on the left of the door, with one button clearly marked ‘Hostal Oriente’. We hadn’t managed to warn them we were late, so were greatly relieved when a voice came through the intercom, and the door clicked open. The building is shared with other residential apartments, but don’t worry – it’s quite a select area of the city, and besides, the hotel front door, and every guest room is securely locked. Once inside the pleasant woodlined lobby, make your way to the first floor, which is where reception is. We were extremely grateful at the patience of the night staff – our Spanish isn’t great, and neither was his English, but he slowly explained things and checked us in. We found out later that 2am isn’t that late in Madrid, it’s a very nocturnal city! The younger staff on duty during the day spoke fluent English and were equally helpful and patient, explaining where to find the things we needed. Most capital cities are expensive. So affordable rooms are either tiny, or some distance from the city centre. However, we found the rooms here big enough for us both, plus suitcases (which were swallowed by the huge walk-in wardrobe) with surprisingly high airy ceilings, and an en-suite bathroom you could actually stand up and turn around in! On the subject of the bathroom, I suffered a cold shower on the first morning, before I realised the tap over the DOOR governed the water temperature, as well as the tap over the bath! Our room had windows opening onto an internal courtyard, which is a fairly typical Spanish custom. No great view, but fresh air, and no traffic noise. Even the front rooms should be quiet, as the square outside is pedestrianized, which is very welcome in such a nocturnal city. And what a location! That deserted square at the front turned out have the opera house on the other side, plus the ‘Opera’ metro station, plus a taxi rank which was very handy. There’s a ‘Proxima’ convenience store selling food just across the road. It’s about 10 minutes walk through pedestrianized streets to the main metro station at Sol and Plaza Mayor. The palace is 5 minutes walk past the opera house. Best of all, the streets between the hotel and Plaza Mayor are awash with great restaurants, as well as a chocolate shop recommended by several guidebooks, selling the ever-popular chocolate con churros. We ate at a different restaurant every night here, and there were still plenty we hadn’t visited at the end of the week. Bear in mind that the nocturnal habits of the city mean that shops don’t tend to open until 9.30am, which can be a challenge when you’ve popped out to buy your breakfast. We quickly learnt to buy our breakfast the night before. On the subject of late nights, the yellow airport bus runs all through the night (every 30 minutes), only costs 2 Euros per person, has lots of special racks to carry everyone’s luggage, and terminates at a central location with plenty of taxis available. We saved a lot of money by getting the bus from the airport to the city, and only then taking a taxi from the bus terminus to the hotel. A taxi all the way would have been 30 to 35 Euros. I highly recommend this airport bus, rather than a taxi or the metro. Anyway, enough about Madrid. We would definitely recommend Hostal Oriente, we were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Two details I wish I knew before I booked this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: WOWBoston
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the 2nd floor of a residential building in the very center of Madrid. Location is excellent! Our room was facing back - no view, but the room itself had been newly renovated, clean and very quiet. Service was nice and helpful. Everything was fine during our 4 nights stay, but I'd like to share two details that I found unnecessary and/or unpleasant. The first is an EXCESSIVE use of air fresheners. The whole hotel smells (!) like a chemical factory. Our room was SATURATED with this annoying scent: curtains, bed cover, bathroom walls, inside closet, everything! We kept the window open all the time and, per our request, the cleaning person didn't use it in this room any more, but still the smell was way too intense. The second piece of information is that each time you want to lock the safe in your room, it will cost you one euro. I found it annoying, because we were not informed that this is how the safe in our room operates.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel position (IMHO) in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: drAMONraf
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located in plaza isabela II, just in front Opera subway station, very close to Porta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, La Latina, Plalacio Real, La Gran Via..etc..etc.. There are a lot of restaurant inside the plaza (also McDonalds and Burger King, if you want a cheeper one), and 24h food store... The Movida is behind your foot.. Note that you need a sleeping mask, and maybe also the ear plug, to sleep better. The hotel room is clean, but a little bit small, and no breakfast is possible, also there isn't a bidet...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value...”
Reviews.Author: Gezginelif
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in January. It is very clean and warm. The staff is excellent and very helpfull. It is right in the heart of the city by the metro stop, Opera. Most of the sites are within walking distance. All the shops restaurants cafes are on the same street as the hotel. The only thing, there is no breakfast. It would be better if it had. But if that's no problem for you, there are to many restaurants right by the hotel. The cost is very low also considering the location. So it's great value. If i ever go back to Madrid, i'd deffinetely stay there again. The only thing you should consider that i didnt is dont stay for long since there isnt too much to see in Madrid. But Toledo, fantastic place.

Reviews.Title: “My 1st choice of place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Nads2011
Reviews.Content: I visit Madrid often to viit family and this is always my first choice of where to stay ... It is right in the centre of Madrid, excellent value, clean and secure. I have stayed at least 6 times in the past 2 years and never had one problem. The staff are friendly and the rooms are cleaned to an excellent standard every day. Rooms are air conditioned aswell so when staying in the summer months it is very comfortable. I always email and ask for a quiter room away from the main road however on the one occasion I forgot I did not find the noise from the main street ... a lighter sleeper may do though so just ask them if you would prefer a quiter room. The hotel has free wifi aswell which is great for keeping intouch when staying away from home :) Would recommend staying here to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lennox M
Reviews.Content: Just repeating what all the other positive reviews have said - a great location (next to the metro, in the middle of the shopping and restaurant area) and safe, clean, comfortable rooms. For the price, it is hard to beat. Staff are friendly and accomodating. Yes, if you have a room that opens onto the street (as we did, on the 2nd floor) you will hear noise coming up but only take that as a negative if this sort of thing bothers you (it doesn't bother us). Madrid is a city that barely sleeps, so the noise is there all night as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: Pros: Room very clean Excellent Location - right by Opera. To get to the main shopping are turn right and you're pretty much there. Turn left out the hotel to the Opera and Palicio real. Very reasonably priced Check in and out quick and efficient There is no breakfast, this is not a problem as there are plenty of places to eat nearby e.g. Cafe et te which serve food. There is also a McDonald's practically next door to the hotel. Cons: You will need to have some knowledge of Spanish, when I was there 2 members of staff on duty spoke no English. Thankfully this wasn't a problem for me however it was for some other guests. If you don't have a basic grasp of Spanish you may wish to consider somewhere else. I had a single room on the back which was fairly quite in terms of noise from outside the building. However one could clearly hear activity in the corridor. Not much space in the toilet cubicle, not a problem for me but possibly it would be if you were generously proportioned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room & Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sebholland
Reviews.Content: The room and the location of Hostal Oriente are perfect. Together with having a reasobale rate this makes Hostal Orinete a very good choise. The room looked classic and nice. It had anough space for an extra bed for our son. Though on the street side, the noise was not to bad. After all it's an pedestrian street. No motorised vehicels. Missed a bit that there is no breakfast available in the place itself, but more for atmosphere than something else because. next door there is a branch of a famous Spanish fast food chain, where you can have sandwiches, rolls, coffee fresh juice etc. Yes, not everybody speaks English, but I think that's hardly a problem. Als the lady who didn.t speak English could point us to the police which we unfortunatly needed. The bad English of the police officers is more a problem! Entrance to first floor is not impressive, but once you are inside: Room is nice and rate reasonable, so together with the perfect location: highly recommanded!

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Heka_BR
Reviews.Content: The hostal location is excelente, in front of one exit of the Opera metro. There is no way to get wrong. Close to the main atractions and everything: shop, restaurants, etc. Nice and clean room, had everything I need. I did no have problem with the communication as I speak spanish. They also offer free internet access at one computer they have.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: livingfortoday
Reviews.Content: We completely echo all of the positive reviews of this hostal. It is very easy to find once you exit the Opera metro station, being immediately opposite. It is true that the chap on reception does not speak much English but this was not a problem on checking in and the lovely ladies who keep the accommodation so clean speak very good English and work on reception sometimes too. The rooms that our friends and ourselves occupied were extremely clean, as were all areas, and comfortable. Our room was on the front of the hostal and street noise was heard into the small hours, whereas our friends' room on the back was quiet. It is possible to leave your luggage there while you go off and explore, as we did on our last day. There is a coffee machine in the general area on the second floor, and a table where you can sit and eat lunch or breakfast, which can be purchased from the supermarket opposite. There is 15 minutes of free internet in the same room. McDonalds is virtually next door and serves very good coffee at a reasonable price. The location of the Oriente is superb, just a short walk away from the Palace and Plaza Mayor, from where we got on the Red Top bus and also the starting point for the excellent Sandemans' free walking tour. The Tourist Information Office is also in this location. Both of these were excellent starting points for exploring the city, especially the walking tour, learning a lot about the city from Anouschka, our enthusiastic guide. A tip from her worth sharing is that the Palace has free entrance on Wednesdays for those with an EU passport - but be prepared for long queues unless you get there early. She pointed out the Chocolateria San Gines, just around the corner from the hostal Oriente, where you can enjoy churros and hot chocolate or coffee 24/7 - very nice but very filling - 6 each is rather a lot, we couldn't eat them all! We bought a two-day red top bus tour ticket and did a tour on each day, including transport to the Bernabeu stadium and extra tours in the evening to see the city lit up rather than booking extra night tours for that purpose. You can get to all of the major sights on the red bus. We also purchased the ten trip metro ticket from the airport which can be shared between your party and this worked out well. All in all a very good trip to Madrid with the Hostal Oriente providing an excellent base.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: jt10s
Reviews.Content: Located directly above Placa Oriente where street performers come out at night with the national theater just meters away, you're paying for location here. The room was nothing to write home about, clean but small. Decent selection of cable channels. Reception was unobtrusive and spoke limited English. No restaurant on-site but tons right in the vicinity. However, as previously mentioned, walkable to almost all major sites in the old part of Madrid. El Prado Museum would've been maybe the farthest, at 20-25 minutes away, but the Madrid metro is excellent. Overall, Hostal Oriente represented good value for a clean, decent property with an excellent location. My room faced the inner courtyard so there wasn't any extraneous noise, but walls are relatively thin so I could hear snoring from another room (!) I was happy with my stay and would recommend. Travel tips: (1) It’s worth checking on-line to see what events are on during your visit. You may be surprised to learn of the many free things available. For instance, I lined up with the other (cheap… er, budget conscious) artlovers at the Prado Museum. Usual entry is €10 but the museum is free from 6-8pm. The line moved quickly and within 10 minutes, we were in. Invest €3.50 of the money you saved on an audioguide, an excellent resource for giving the history and interesting backstories of the many Biblical and mythological-themed works. (2) Another valuable freebie is Sandeman’s city tours (www.neweuropetours.eu). Done by excellent passionate freelance guides, there are free walking city tours (guides work on tips only) as well as reasonably priced paid tours in 14 cities across Europe. (FYI, the guide must pay the tour company €2.50 per passenger, so remember to factor that into your tip). The 3 hour walking tour I did was an excellent orientation to the city. (3) Using the metro from the airport to get to Hostal Oriente was an easy 50 minute trip. Yes, you have to change lines twice, but I arrived in the early afternoon and the cars were never overcrowded. Madrid offers discounted 10-trip metro cards. There is also an unlimited 2-day tourist metro card that is roughly the same price. However, note that trips to / from the airport will require a €1 supplement. For more travel tips on things to do in Madrid, including catching a flamenco show and where to find the best tapas, check out my travel blog as I take a trip around the world. http://dreamtravelblog.wordpress.com/2011/10/23/spanish-people-are-good-looking/

Reviews.Title: “excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: greeny1083
Reviews.Content: From the outside this hostal looks like just a normal house and once through the front door you can see that other floors are dedicated to normal living quarters However dont let this put you off staying here the room i had was clean , comfortable and the best possible location for sight seeing i Madrid Just 50 paces or so from Opera Metro station So finding it is real easy it's just a two minuite walk to the Palace Royal & around a five mins walk to Puetra de Sol Also well within walking distance is Parque del Reitro , Plaza De Cibeles & Plaza Mayor Also tgher are plety of Cafe , bars & Resturants nearby Stay here and save yourself alot of time and money by staying here Did i mention that it was cheap aswell ? this Accomadation is a NO BRAINER Book Now

Reviews.Title: “Best Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Agile13
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the cheap place in the center of everything – it is the place!! It is 5 minutes away fromPuerta del Sol, 2 minutes from Royal Palace, 30 minutes form Prado, 20 minutes from La Latina, 0 minutes to Opera and Metro (walking distance)!! There are a lot of cafes near the hostal where you can eat breakfast. When you walk out of the hostal you find yourself in the pedestrian area – very convenient )) !! 24 hours shop is in the opposite building. Hostal is situated in the block of apartments, just walk to the door and ring the bell ) Rooms are small but clean, they change towels everyday, staff is very nice (we needed to print airplane tickets – it was not a problem !!))). If you what to get good view ask room with windows to the street, but it will be a little noisy in the morning, but with closed windows it is ok. We stayed in August it was not so hot, also there is air condition in every room.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and well located”
Reviews.Author: BostonDaveL
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to leave your belongings while you are out exploring Madrid. You probably won't want to spend a lot of time there because the room is very small and not at all picturesque. But the location is superb -- just a few yards from the Opera metro station exit and no more than a 15 minute walk from all the major attractions in downtown Madrid -- and we booked a double room for just under $100 a night. Other pros include air conditioning, free wi-fi and a shared PC for those who don't bring laptops, and an elevator (I'm not sure if all hostals have those). Other cons include relatively thin walls and a front desk that's not always staffed, requiring you to look around for a bit to get assistance. Overall, an excellent choice for the budget-conscious traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and minimum fuss”
Reviews.Author: fitzrovians
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night whilst in transit between Morocco and Sweden and was looking for a low cost option close to the old city centre. The location is superb, being almost in front of the Opera Metro station (which is two quick metro changes from the Airport) and also located right in the heart of the old quarter of Madrid. The room I had was a small single, with its own en-suite. The room was quite small (but I was expecting that) but was very clean and tidy. No trouble at all with the reception. Wireless internet free of charge after getting an access code from reception. On the whole very good value for money for its excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, staff and appliances = perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Patrij01
Reviews.Content: I would happily recommend this to all travellers. The location is perfect, we never had a problem with noise. Everything was new in the room and it was extremely clean and perfect size. The staff (even though there was little English spoken- to the other reviewers- your in a foreign country, get over it!!) were incredibly friendly and tried very hard. I would definitely stay here again and again without fail.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: Yotam H
Reviews.Content: I had two days to spend in Madrid and chose Hostal Oriente after reading the reviews here. The place is very nice. Room was very clean, with ensuit bathroom that was also very nice. The room is very small (I had a single room) with a single bed (i.e. a youth bed for only one person). It was enough for me. Shower was also tiny. I asked for a room that does not face the street so it was quite but without any view. The walls are very thin so if someone was talking in the lobby I could here that (but not that loud). At the first morning there were constructions in the building so it was noisy, but at the second one it was quite (it was Saturday). The location of the hostal is great, just near the Opera square and metro station. Very close to the Oriente Palace. I will definitely consider staying there again once I come back to Madrid. The staff was lovely, even though most of them do not speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean and comfortable...might be a bit noisy for a light sleeper”
Reviews.Author: SamGorchuk
Reviews.Content: Hostal Oriente is close to the Opera Metro Station on the pedestrian zone and very close to the Royal Palace. This was good news and bad news. The good news it was very central to many attractions including the Prado (a bit of a walk). The bad news: if you are a light sleeper (my wife) the Hostal, being on the pedestrian zone, was a bit noisy for her even with the double paned windows closed and air conditioning going. But, if you are a deeper sleeper (me) I didn't notice the noise. Take earplugs and you should be fine. The room was simple but clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: taccojack
Reviews.Content: Nice place - room was very clean. Great location too!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: cei359
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after a long trip in northern Spain. We had only the last few days of our trip in Madrid and at first needed a hotel for just one night, since we had planned to move to a hotel nearer to the airport to catch our 6am flight. However, after staying here one night, we decided to stay another and reserve an airport transfer because we liked the hotel so much. The room we had was very clean, and looked out over the street (which I suppose was slightly noisy at night, but we were still able to sleep). There view from the window was great for people watching. The location is wonderful, we were very near Sol and the Opera metro stop, which was convenient for food, shopping and going out. There was one computer with free internet for shared use, but we never had to wait to use it. The staff was nice and professional however, they weren't overly helpful or friendly. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value and confort”
Reviews.Author: Carol024
Reviews.Content: This hostel is a find! Near major attractions, touristic information, clean, cosy, simple. The only down was noise at night because of the street, bus even so wonderful experience and great value for such a nice hostel.

Reviews.Title: “It is in such a terrific location that main door of the Hostel is few steps away from the exit of Opera metro station”
Reviews.Author: ArghyaKolkata
Reviews.Content: I have visited so many countries but I have never come across such a location that the main door of the Hostel is just a few steps away from the exit of the Opera metro station. It is surrounded good shopping centers. There is a pedestrian walk that starts from this hostel and ends at SOL metro station. Opera to SOL walking is fantastic and vibrant. It is surrounded by good nightlife area. I had booked private single ensuite room. This Hostel rooms are clean and nice. They accept credit card. They provide free internet at second floor for fifteen minutes. The owner cannot speak English but their other staffs can speak English. It is good value for money as far as the location is concerned. They do not provide complimentary breakfast. They have 24 hrs receptions. McDonald’s restaurant is adjacent to this Hostel. Carte De Engles shopping mall is also nearby. I recommend this Hostel to every people travelling to Madrid. I once again repeat that its location is really excellent and terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money accomodation in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: h_mchugh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is such great value for money. For 65 euro a night you get a comfortable and clean ensuite room, with flat screen tv, air con and free wifi in an excellent location. The hotel is literally just round the corner from the royal palace and plaza oriente which are both beautiful. It is also really well located for public transport links, bars and restaurants. There is a 24 hour shop across the street which is really handy especially when you arrive late as we did. The staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful. Even though they didn't speak much english, we managed to get by with the little bit of spanish we could speak. Madrid itself is a lovely city. My one criticism would be that the hop on hop off bus was not as good as in other cities we have visited. We always use these tours on city breaks to see all the places of interest, but there was only one bus company in madrid offering the tour, and the scope if the 2 routes that they offered I didn't feel was that great. It felt like on both routes we just went up and down the same roads, and I was left feeling that the city must have more to offer. The buses were also extremely busy and on both days we had to wait for more than an hour to get on a bus as all the ones that came past were full. We bought a 2 day pass, but my advice would be to save your money and use the metro which us quick, cheap and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “The best hostal in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: judytripad
Reviews.Content: Very clean, very friendly staff, can only recommend! The location is perfect in every sense, near public TP, near shopping centers, near dining and fiesta. Rooms rated 3 because sometimes they are quite small, but still OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Sarahbear1116
Reviews.Content: This hostal (more like a hotel) is excellently located in Madrid. We could literally see the metro station from our room. The staff was more than helpful, and very courteous. Our room was clean and tastefully, yet simply decorated. I never allow my daughter to take a bath (only showers) in hotels, but I had no reservations about allowing her to play away in the spotless bathtub. There is a computer with free internet in the common area and free Wifi in the room. It's a shame, because I am sorry to say that I will not be staying there again. The noise throughout the night was loud and non-stop. I don't consider myself a light sleeper, but there were people outside drunkenly yelling and making noise until like 6am. I was ready to scream out the window! And call me crazy, but I could swear that they were doing construction outside.....all...night. This hotel is great, maybe for someone who can sleep through an earthquake. I would recommend this hotel, but try to get a room away from the street if you want to sleep at night.

Reviews.Title: “You What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: kcribb1
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? I stayed at the hostal for 3 night until such time that I could not take it any longer. The noise in the hostal drove me nuts! It was so LOUD: phones ringing, beeping noises, loud employees and loud neighbors! This was daily. It got so bad that I moved to the Hotel Moderno for a night of restful sleep. For 40 Euro per night I shouldn't have set lofty expectations. I read the reviews before I left, but I never expected to be awaken by the noises. I will say the location is difficult to beat as the Metro Opera is directly across the street from the hostal. When I was leaving the hostal I was stopped by hotel staff whereby they had no record of my payment. I promptly produced my credit card receipt showing full payment for 4 nights (I stayed 3 nights). I was advised that the gentleman who took the payment did not record the payment.

Reviews.Title: “not your ordinary hostel”
Reviews.Author: poveste
Reviews.Content: This hostel was amazing. I had a private room and bathroom, so it wasn't the typical dormitory type situation. I like that type of setup and I didn't realize this when I booked it, but it had the most beautiful interior, it was extremely clean and the staff were very friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and central location, near bars, shops and restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: Ailes60
Reviews.Content: We were at first given a dark room at the back looking onto a washing line, but after asking to be moved to a room at the front with a balcony, this was promptly done very speedily the next morning. (They had no front rooms for the first night). The front room was overlooking the square, which was being renovated so was very noisy with drilling all day, but it wasn't a big problem as we were out most of the day. It was also quite noisy all night as it is a lively area, but that was ok for us. Really liked the location, as good bars ,shops and restaurants were on the doorstop. Most memorable bar in a nearby side street was called 1917, a perfect place to end the evening. Great music, lighting,cocktails, vodka, blinis and plumcake. Wonderful!! Only downside to our trip to Madrid was when we were targeted by a team of pickpockets on the metro from the airport . Be very aware of a well dressed man with a coat over his arm!! He failed ,as we had removed our valuables from back pockets. The authorities should clamp down on this, as this was not an isolated incident. We had already read of this happening to someone else. It was not a good first impression of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Simply... Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: oneTraveller2010
Reviews.Content: It is my second time here. Both OK! Room: OK, clean, quite, in a good condition. Position: perfect, 10 steps to the Opera station, few minutes walking to Sol, 20 min to Renfe Atocha. Services: - small 24h shop on the other side of the street. - WiFi works fine. - Be carefull, people on reception are kind but speak NO english. In my opinion a perfect balance among price/service/position!

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel but be very careful to get a quiet room”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_traveller2031
Reviews.Content: This hotel (is actually a hostal not a hotel - we were not clear on the difference until we arrived) offers a good value basic stay in a great location. Service is minimal as it is a hostal but the rooms and common areas are spotless and nicely decorated. We had a significant problem on our first night. We were given a room in the middle section, with rooms on either side. The walls are paper thin and when the showers were being used on either side you could hear everything. I could also hear the person next door very clearly all night every time he coughed or made any noise. After a sleepless night I was ready to leave but we asked for and were given a quiet room and after that everything was just fine. We stayed for four nights in total. If you are looking for a budget stay in a good location, I would recommend this provided you get a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “What a location!”
Reviews.Author: YngveGS
Reviews.Content: The location of this hostal is just spectacular! I was so impressed. It's so in the centre of Madrid that i was surprised when i arrived and was able to orientate my selfe abit. But it is not a proper hotel, but not what you would call a hostel either. Something in between. A hostel with good rooms i would say. The price was ok. Main problems, as many others has pointed out, no one speaks any english there. That might be a challenge. But you'll manage!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with booking!!”
Reviews.Author: AUDtraveler
Reviews.Content: Great little place. Rooms are small but lovely, clean and secure. Minimal noise for central location. Would be good if reception spoke more English. Would book again!

Reviews.Title: “clean but noisy”
Reviews.Author: kamibe
Reviews.Content: I had booked a single room at Hostal Oriente well in advance and when I arrived I was quite shocked when I was brought to a room no. 114 which had no window. A single bed, two doors leading to the bathroom and another door to the wardrobe. I had booked for a 4 night stay and really did not fancy staying in a windowless airless room! I really was annoyed and marched back immediatetely to reception to say that this was a room not acceptable. So they put me up one flight up into room 215 which had a window leading to the courtyard. The room was clean and it was cleaned every day. Television, but only in Spanish, a little table, no fridge, a single bed with a very hard pillow and a bedside table. Very spartanic interior. And the walls are indeed paperthin, you can hear everything. Someone woke me up because the hairdryer was used at 1.30 am. Doors slamming all the time, it really is frustrating, can they not close the doors quietly? I got some earplugs which made sleeping easier. Considering the price and the room I would not stay there again. I travelled with a group and we were staying in different hostals, the others went to Hostal Madrid, paid approximately 5 Euros more but had a balcony. Which I suppose is quite nice for a relaxing glass of wine, rather than looking out into the windows of the other guests. The location is very good, just a few steps away from the station Opera.

Reviews.Title: “good location,with some problems”
Reviews.Author: apfeltee
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in the Hostel. It is in a very good location, the stuff is friendly, but.... Problem1 I booked a double room at Venere.com, but when we arrived, a sigle room was available. They arranged a double, but there it was a room out of order because the lack of the bathroom vent. In the shower there was some refuse....and the vent hood was missing. Problem2 They did not fix the vent, so the bathroom was streamy, the towels did not dry, and when using a toilet, the smell stayed inside. And if someone smoked, you smell the cigarette throught the hole in the ceiling. Problem3 The maid left the windows open, and when we arrived home at midnight, it was cold in the room, but there was no heating. Problem4 One of the towels was dirty!!!!!! It is only a hostel, but nice ,these problems are because the thoughtlessness of the stuff. (Except for the thin walls, you can hear everithing...) What a pity.

Reviews.Title: “Would Highly Recommend This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigVinney
Reviews.Content: The location is great, 75M from the Opera metro station and near lots of good restaurents. If you go out of the hotel, turn right and take the 1st right a few yards down that road there is an all you can eat buffet restaurent for 8.95 (great value...) The room was nice and clean but as we were located at the front it was a little bit noisy. They are reflooring the Opera square and the buidling work starts at 8:30 each morning. The staff was friendly, but couldn't speak any English however they were very pleasant and helpful. Wifi worked very well. We stayed there for 3 nights and payed about 82 eros for a three person room (no breakfast). I would definately stay at the hotel again, great location at a great price

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Located literality few...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location! Located literality few steps away from the opera metro, we actually missed it when we reached; just keep a lookout for a pizza store, it's just right above it. Security's good as we have to use a security card to access the main door. Just that our room was on the 2nd floor and Hubby was worried about people climbing in; but there were none. Room was clean with towels and a small table for writing. Within walking distance to the royal palace and main square, plus there were lotsa eateries nearby. Desk staff were friendly and helpful and speak English. They also allowed us to keep our lugguage at their place after check-out. :)

Reviews.Title: “recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: oppnoa
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the room was nice and clean but since it was in the front it was a little bit noisy. The stuff was friendly, couldn't speak any English but still, tried to help as much as possible. Wifi worked nicely. We stayed there for 4 nights and payed about 85 eros a day for three people (no breakfast). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: stepanka
Reviews.Content: In brief - excellent location, nice, tidy rooms and very friendly, helpful staff. I really enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal spot for a few days”
Reviews.Author: QueenieBeats
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in Madrid solo. Single room, compact but clean, no breakfast, wifi non existent in the room, used the computer on the second level, great location right on Calle del Arenal - so just steps to everything in any direction. Paid 41 euro for the weekday and 45 euro for weekend - no breakfast. Some of the staff speak English, others made the attempt.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: hjyoung
Reviews.Content: The location is great (it's on a pedestrian mall so street noise is minimal, it is next to Opera metro station), the rooms are quiet, everything works. I read previous reviews of this hotel and found few of them to be relevant during our visit: the air conditioners worked well, I could not hear the residents of adjacent rooms. No, the staff does not speak English, but the hotel is in Spain!! The rooms ARE small but they are clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Almost like a hotel with private bathrooms and TV”
Reviews.Author: cloud925
Reviews.Content: With our room having a private bathroom and a TV, it almost seemed like we were staying at a hotel. Our room and bathroom were cleaned daily, which was nice but not necessary. The hostal is located steps away from the Opera Metro station, so getting around was extremely cheap and convenient (especially since the metro goes to the airport as well). There was also a desktop computer with free internet access in the common area available for guests to use. We only dealt with the staff either early in the morning or late at night, and the one man we dealt with only spoke Spanish, so it was a little difficult communicating with him (but not impossible). The one negative aspect of our stay was the air conditioning; as soon as we turned it on, a strong unpleasant odor (likely stale tobacco) filled the room. However, we got used to this pretty quickly and it didn't bother us for long. Otherwise, the rooms were great value for the price we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Pimlicogirl
Reviews.Content: I chose Hostal Oriente because of other reviews on tripadvisor, and I feel like I made a good choice. We stayed for four nights at the end of July, beginning of August, during Madrid's hot summer, and the AC functioned very well. Our room, although *quite* small, was clean and well-maintained. Towels and sheets were changed daily (although I would have liked the option to skip that, simply because of the waste involved). You do have to put your hotel key in to activate the electricity, which means that AC does not stay on during the day -- but it's a matter of minutes, once you return, to get comfortably cool again. (I say this not really for myself, but there are others who have little tolerance for less-than-frigid rooms when it's hot). The staff were incredibly helpful with suggestions for where to eat and how to get around. I speak Spanish, so I have no idea how good their English skills are. The best thing about this hotel is the location: steps away from the Opera metro station, a short walk to the Royal Palace in one direction and a short walk to Puerta del Sol in the other. If the temps are a bit cooler than they were for us in the summer, I'd say you could even walk to the Prado in about 20-25 mins. Even if it is hot, the metro system in Madrid is wonderfully efficient, easy to use, and cheap (1 euro trip, no apparent limit on transfers), so you could duck underground to save some time and/or strength. The area where the hotel is in is safe, if incredibly busy -- there are lots of people around, all the time. The hotel has free wifi (you need to ask for the password at the desk), as well as a couple of public desktops for guests to use. The walls are a bit thin, so if you have neighbors, you'll hear them. Most people are out and about all day though, so this wasn't a problems for us. All in all, if you are looking for a good base for exploring Madrid, this is a good one. It's a good value, in a great location. Just don't expect a big room!

Reviews.Title: “Great hostal in an incredible location”
Reviews.Author: BrazilianTraveller84
Reviews.Content: I must say that I had an incredible time at Hostal Oriente. The best thing of this Hostal is obviously the location: just two steps from the Opera Station, in one of the main streets of Madrid's center (Calle Arenal), less than five minute walking from Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor and the Royal Palace. Good souvenirs' stores on the surroundings and lots of restaurants and bars that gave me plenty of options to eat anytime I wanted. All in all, I had a great time at Hostal Oriente. As I was traveling alone, I can't complain about the room's space. Finally, the only problem is the air conditioner, that could be a little stronger - but that wasn't really a problem, once I didn't have any trouble to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: bewe4
Reviews.Content: Would like to second most of the postive responses here. This place is great value for money. Top location, super clean, modern interior and very good price. Staff may not speak much english (I spoke spanish) and the walls are thin so you might hear people on the floor or other rooms (I heard no noise from the streets). All in all highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent, Enjoyable Stay & Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Adam11
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Hostal Oriente for 5 nights in june. during that time we found the staff to be both friendly and efficient and always ready to assist or advise us. The room we stayed in was clean and adequately equipped for our needs (Air con, Tv, En suite bathroom), although not overly spacious the room was large enough for two people, and the room was cleaned and the beds made every day of our stay, the only minor points concerning our room were the view (our room was a back room, so the view from the window was an internal view), and the shower, mainly because it was one of these set over a bath in this case a really really small bath, and it was slightly awkward and dangerous to enter and exit. Aside from these minor annoyances we had no complaints about our stay at all, finding the hostal excellent value for money. The major plus point of Hostal Oriente is its location, which we found perfect for visiting most of Madrids sights. It is within a 100 meters from the metro station Opera, and only a 5 minute walk to the Palacio Real, Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor & The Gran Via, a truly ideal location and one of the cheapest in the area as well. Would definetly go back and i recommend whole heartedly.

Reviews.Title: “great location,nice and clean, very happy to recommend”
Reviews.Author: 2xKiwis
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading other trip advisor recommendations and we were very happy with this little hotel. They have a small lift so one doesn't need to carry heavy suitcases upstairs. The little glasses in balcony was a bonus and the rooms clean and comfortable. There is a nice little cafe opposite for breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfy Hotel in Amazing Location for Excellent Price”
Reviews.Author: Betty1981Uk
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed for three nights in May 10 and chose Oriente because we were on a budget. Initially we were worried sick as we thought it might be right on the borderline of being a hostel and a hotel but once we arrived we were very pleasantly surprised at how lovely this cheap little hotel was. The entry is a bit offputting as the reception is on the first floor of a building shared wth appartments but once you are inside the décor throughout the rooms and public areas is very nice and fresh and the whole place is spotlessly clean. The reception staff were very friendly although they had very little English but it was easy to make yourself understood. Our room was a pretty decent size and very modern with a good sized cupboard and a french window looking onto the street below that was excellent for people watching! Double glazed windows meant that the noise at night wasn't too bad at all. Although there was no breakfast there were drinks machines in the public area and the free internet was a nice touch. The best thing about this hotel thouhg was the location, right in the heart of the old city next to a metro station and minutes walk from the palace, cathederal, puerta del sol, plaza mayor and surrounded by restaurants and cafés. We would definitely recommend this place to anyone trying to do Madrid on a budget and who is only planning to use their hotel as a base while out sightseeing all day.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Brali060310
Reviews.Content: A great location and kept very clean. The rooms were what you would expect for the price the only thing that was missing a little is the reception did not speak much english but still tried to be helpful as they could.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: moreboba
Reviews.Content: The location is on a touristy street/closed paved road, but if you are a tourist, it is perfect because of the shops and ATMs nearby. Also most of what you want to see in Madrid is at most a 20 minute walk away. It's not a 5 star hotel but it offers a good, clean, and comfortable room with AC to rest and sleep in. Go up 1 floor for the reception when entering the building. Was lost in the hallway before someone guided us upstairs. Also it's a safe building with locked entry. Stayed in their Triple Room - it had 3 twin size beds w/en suite bath. The shower was like 3x3 ft, but I think this is typical of places this type. Room had a TV and a mini balcony that overlooked the street. Always clean with plenty of space. The owner - I presume the man at reception, was nice and warned me about closing my bag. At night the owners sat and watched TV in the little open lounge/room. Had a phrasebook, but it was useless, however with hand signals and a few words, was able to convey that we needed to pay early and get a taxi at 3am.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: AuroraSky
Reviews.Content: I struggled to understand the metro system in Madrid and wasn't sure I'd ever get to my hotel. People were very helpful and so I got off at the Opera stop for this hotel. And there it was, no need to ask directions! I found all the people working at the reception friendly and eager to help. While they didn't speak much English, it didn't matter as we were able to understand each other. The room was small but very clean. The walls weren't soundproof but hey, I was on an amazing street in a hotel that was extremely convenient for someone travelling alone and not knowing the language. There was also a computer with free internet access available for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Go for it!”
Reviews.Author: Fernando_SP
Reviews.Content: We loved it! A great stay for a good price in a excellent location! The only downside is that it is a little noisy. But it is totally worth!

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked”
Reviews.Author: WhycantIbemyself
Reviews.Content: I had a confirmed booking through bookings.com, but when I arrived they had no room. They took me round the corner to the Hostal las Fuentes, which was fine, but I still think this an unacceptable practice.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot, great price - if you get the right room”
Reviews.Author: mags2820
Reviews.Content: Our flight was delayed by 2 hours so it was 11.30pm before we finally found Hostal Oriente. It is right at the bottom of Calle Arenal, about a minute from Opera metro station. Pay attention to the street numbers because this hotel does not have any big signs, but a plaque beside a doorway near the Apple shop. It is a great location - within walking distance of most of the sights. The staff member who let us in had no English, and we have no Spanish, but we managed to make ourselves understood. Our room, 104, was a good size, clean with a small bathroom. The window faced onto a courtyard that was more like an outdoor shaft or chute. The room had a very strong smell of incense which we later realised came from a craft shop underneath. Not a good room for asthmatics. It was also oppressively hot, even though it was late November. We had sleepless night because of some very loud whirring sounds from the shaft, the heat and the smell. We decided to ask to be moved. Another staff member could not have been more accommodating and gave us a fabulous room (207) overlooking the Plaza. It was noisy at night with people having fun on the street and in the morning with rubbish collection, but we didn't mind 'cos it was bright and airy with no smell. There is free wifi and the use of a computer on the second floor. Towels are changed daily. We asked for extra pillows but didn't get them - I think the chambermaid didn't understand me. To sum up our experience Oriente is a fabulously located hostal. If you are claustrophobic or sensitive to smells, do not accept one of the internal rooms. Not recommended for those who want a very quiet hotel. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable in Central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: NomadDublin
Reviews.Content: This Hostal gives value to the Budget traveler. My single room cost €46 a night. For this I got a quiet, clean and comfortable single room. The bathroom was larger than most comparable places I've stayed in. The Hostal is on the pedestrianised Calle del Arenal, which links Puerta del Sol with Plaza del Oriente which contains the Palace and Opera House. All the main attractions, such as the Prado Museum, Plaza Mayor etc are in walking distance. Check it out on Google Street Maps - use the street view . The Hostal is on the second floor. Press the buzzer for entrance when you arrive. Afterwards you can use your room card to open the street door.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well maintained hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: BedfordshireEmerald
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hostal Oriente for a three night city break. It took us a few moments to find it as it has no front windows, just a door between two restaurants. You buzz the door for access, but once you have your room key you swipe yourself in as you please. The reception is on the first floor and the rooms are through another door on the second floor. The accomodation is very clean and bright with fresh towels daily. The bathroom is small but look new and is well equiped. We did run out of hot water one morning as we arose later. The staff are friendly and helpful and we managed to communicate in half English, half Spanish! The room had air conditioning and a safety deposit box, that cost 1 Euro to re-lock every time you opened it. The hostal does not have a restaurant but there are plenty to choose from directly outside.The location of the hostal is fantastic, in the heart of old Madrid, a stroll from the Palacio Real in one direction and the Plaza Mayor in the other. On the last day we needed to check out by midday, but were able to leave our luggage at the hostal until we headed for the airport later. Overall a great Hostal that we would definately stay at agin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and fresh rooms”
Reviews.Author: Wentwest
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days at the end of October. The first room was quite large but faced the street and construction, so it was noisy. We changed rooms and the second room was very quiet but smaller and the shower was very, very small. No washing your feet in there. The hotel's internet was down, which was a pain, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: NWong
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, surrounded by restaurants and close to all the major tourist sites like Puerto del Sol, Plaza Mayor and the Royal Palace. I arrived about 11:30 a.m. and was checked in but asked to come back in 45 minutes so the room could be cleaned. Since they were upgrading me to a double room for the price of a single, I was happy to explore and they kept my luggage for me. The room was simply decorated and spotlessly clean. The bed was comfortable and there were plenty of clean towels. There was also face soap and body gel, but no shampoo. The shower was small but clean, with plenty of hot water. My room was away from the street and quiet, except for the occasional guest returning after a night of partying. While I could hear people in the hallway, it was never a problem. Every time I needed any help/advice from the staff, they were friendly and helpful. They were also tolerant of my Spanglish and communication wasn't a problem. I can't wait to go back to Madrid and will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean room in good location”
Reviews.Author: GCake1105
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights for vacation. We arrived late and checked in without a problem, but the receptionist stayed on the phone for half the time while we were trying to check in. This place is great because it is located on one of the major streets in Madrid, Calle del Arenal extremely close to the Opera metro station, in fact, so close that we passed it and then had to go back towards the metro station. It is across the street from a small convenience store. You have to buzz in and then go up one floor to get to the reception, the building is shared I believe. There is an elevator. Our room was quite small but had everything we needed - bathroom, working air conditioner, small closet, phone, safe. For some reason none of the hotels we stayed at in Spain had a clock. The only thing is the housekeeping came in at about 9 a.m. while we were still sleeping, and we had no hanging door sign to let them know "DO NOT DISTURB" so that was a bit alarming. There was a computer w/ free internet on our floor which was convenient. Air conditioner was nice and cold, and strong, no problems there. No restaurant/breakfast served. They stored our luggage for us after we checked out. I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: HH_Trav
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 3 different hotels in Madrid - this one being the cheapest and lowest * quality. I was so surprised that this actually turned out to be the best one! It is extremely clean and in a great location. And quiet!! Finally, a hotel in Madrid that is quiet!! The front desk staff didn't speak English and my Spanish isn't anything to brag about, but he was able to write my room number on a piece of paper. If you don't speak Spanish, don't expect for the front desk staff to give you a map and tell you every place you need to go (as they did in my 4* hotel)! My only complaints are that the air conditioning unit started leaking in the middle of the night (not sure what that was about or maybe it was somehow due to the people showering at the same time?) Luckily it wasn't too hot so I just turned it off and cleaned up the mess. Also, the shower in my single room was tiny. Like tiny in the sense that it is the smallest shower I've ever seen and if you weigh more than 150 lbs you'll have issues moving around. Despite all that, I'd definitely stay here again if I ever find myself in Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: brmbrgh
Reviews.Content: great hotel, couldn't have asked for more for our money, much better than expected. clean, very friendly and helpful. all round just right.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location - and charming staff”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBros
Reviews.Content: This is a ok hotel with great loaction - next to the opera. Perferct. The staff doesn't speak English, but no problems with the service. - Good value for money. - Weak shower (and bathroom very small) - The WIFI didn't work that well - Very friendly staff - Very clean We would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Patrikbzz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in May. This is a great hotel if you are looking for good location, walking distance to Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor and Palacio Real, and close to underground. The rooms were far better than you can expect for this type of hotel. The owner clearly takes price in his hotel, clean and looked renovated. Can definitely reccomend if you are looking for a good base to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: cardiffslim
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in November. Hotel was perfectly clean, staff pleasant and it's in a great location. Only downside was the bloke in a flat next door practising his violin every morning at 10am. Wouldn't normally be a problem but as bars in Madrid stay open till about 6am, this was when we were hoping to get some sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hostal and good location”
Reviews.Author: Roseanne2
Reviews.Content: Hostal Oriente is located right opposite Opera train station and is a good location close to everything. You can walk to Plaza Major, the palace, shops, cafes and a number of other places. We also walked to parque del Retiro although you have the option of the metro. The Hostal is clean, well serviced and we had a small fridge in our room. The rooms are nice and better than I thought they would be, it is quite suitable for any age group. Although I think the rooms could get noisy, it wasn't too bad and they also have free internet for guests. We enjoyed our stay here and I would stay here again. Note the owner did not speak English.

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean, perfect for a weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Zulukoenig
Reviews.Content: great, nice and clean, down to earth, silent, directly in the city center (metro station opera) and anyway very silent and relaxed. airconditioning individually regulated. friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “great location and value”
Reviews.Author: grainnemhaol
Reviews.Content: We are a middle aged but fairly easy-going, not very suave couple - we had a good four-night stay here at Easter. Friendly staff, clean, pleasant. Would go there again. Very good value for the location. We had a reasonably sized room but heard from friends the single rooms can be on the cramped side. (I would bring a small travel kettle next time though as I crave early morning tea...) Ok for a short stay, and right beside a metro stop and an excellent cafe for breakfast.

HotelInfo.Name: Oriente Hostal
HotelInfo.Address: C Arenal 23, 1st Floor, 28013 Madrid, Spain
